thread.title: This naturally occurring slip 'n slide could be Earth's best waterfall
thread.title_full: This naturally occurring slip 'n slide could be Earth's best waterfall

title: This naturally occurring slip 'n slide could be Earth's best waterfall
text:
This naturally occurring slip 'n slide could be Earth's best waterfall Last updated 09:55, August 10 2015 
There are no lines for this naturally forming waterslide located in British Columbia, Canada. Plus, it finishes in a jaw dropping 10.6-metre drop. 
The clips were shot by Devin Supertramp alongside a crew from Torch Paddles who ventured out in to Lynn Canyon Park to uncover the beauty and have some fun. 
The slip n' slide winds through the Canadian cliff top with a smooth surface worn down by the current over time, spitting sliders over the edge of the drop. It takes the backyard past time to a whole new level. Youtube/devingraham 
Lynn Canyon Park in North Vancouver, British Columbia. 
Check out the behind the scenes clip below.
